meanings.definition: A situation in which events happen at the same time by chance.
meanings.sent1: It was a coincidence that we both wore the same color shirt today.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was scheduled for the same time by coincidence.
meanings.sent3: By coincidence, we both ordered the same dish at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The timing of their arrival was a perfect coincidence with the start of the party.
meanings.sent5: The coincidence of finding a four-leaf clover brought them good luck.

meanings.definition: A remarkable concurrence of events or circumstances without apparent causal connection.
meanings.sent1: The coincidence of winning the lottery twice is unbelievable.
meanings.sent2: It was a strange coincidence that they both had the same dream.
meanings.sent3: In a strange coincidence, they both chose the same vacation destination without consulting each other.
meanings.sent4: The coincidence of their paths crossing again after so many years was like fate.
meanings.sent5: The remarkable coincidence of their birthdays being on the same day amazed everyone.
